about_the_game:
In the early 2030s, an event named The Fall shook London and introduced humanity to Vornovians, extraterrestrial beings from Proxima Centauri. What began as a misunderstanding escalated into a human-Vornovian conflict, resolved after 18 months through diplomacy, allowing coexistence and collaboration. Peace has endured for two decades, with Vornovians becoming integral parts of Earth's society.



Sherr-Lok, a detective with unconventional methods, aids the Doyle District Detective Bureau and offers private investigative services. Watt-Sun, once a frontline soldier, battled a decade of homelessness and PTSD before Sherr-Lok mentored him into becoming a detective.

Sherr-Lok and Watt-Sun's next journey sees them navigate a mysterious case involving Peter Baskerville, heir to the infamous Baskerville Hall, just mere months after the death of his uncle. Threats against Peter's life provide the backdrop for a captivating narrative filled with escaped prisoners, shadowy organisations, and a supposed curse that has lasted over 200 years. Sherr-Lok and Watt-Sun take on the case and fight to find the truth behind the long-running mystery.



FEATURES

Save/Load System: Safeguard your progress and continue your adventure at your convenience.
Questions: Navigate through a story that challenges players to prove their knowledge, with correct answers determining unknown consequences.
Music Gallery: Immerse yourself in the game's ambience with a curated soundtrack by Cameron Keywood, brought to life by the musical talents of Tim Beek.

Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Pentium 4 1.7 GHz
  • Memory: 128 MB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel integrated chipset
  • DirectX: Version 9.0

short_description: A sci-fi visual novel reimagining The Hound of the Baskervilles (1902). Follow Vornovians Sherr-Lok & Watt-Sun as they try to uncover the truth of the "curse"
